definition: ordinary people/the "person in the street"/CL:個|个[ge4]

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.chinese: 老百姓都稱其爲“骨架電話機”。

sentences.english: People believe that good is rewarded with good.
sentences.chinese: 因爲在老百姓心裏，好人必有好報。

sentences.english: Ordinary people responded positively to the pilgrims who came into their villages.
sentences.chinese: 老百姓對來到他們村莊的朝聖者明確地作出了反應。

sentences.english: The biggest problem of governor is that people lacks trust in governmental promise.
sentences.chinese: 爲政者最大的問題是，老百姓對政府的承諾缺乏信心。

sentences.english: I think it will never be wrong to expand the economy and make ordinary people rich.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲發展經濟永遠也不會錯，讓老百姓富裕。

sentences.english: I don't intimidate the public, I only intimidate those corrupt officials.
sentences.chinese: 我從來不嚇唬老百姓，只嚇唬那些貪官污吏。

sentences.english: Owing to the danger of air raids, all civilians must vacate from the city.
sentences.chinese: 由於空襲的危險，所有老百姓均須撤離市區。

sentences.english: In the eyes of ordinary people, Beidaihe is an unattainable place.
sentences.chinese: 在老百姓眼中，北戴河是一個可望而不可即的地方。

sentences.english: Urban management law enforcement violence, people violent resistance to law phenomenon affecting social harmony.
sentences.chinese: 城管暴力執法，老百姓暴力抗法的現象影響社會和諧。

sentences.english: But in common people's mind, the Jiangchuan public security's image is suffers a disastrous decline.
sentences.chinese: 而在老百姓的心目中，江川公安的形象更是一落千丈。

sentences.english: Others use the words of ordinary people, called with the bad people in general do not see.
sentences.chinese: 用人家老百姓的話說，叫作不跟小人一般見識。

sentences.english: Civilian trap in the beleaguer city has been airlifted to safety.
sentences.chinese: 被圍困在城裏的老百姓已空運到安全地區。

sentences.english: Bombs rained down on the unarmed common people.
sentences.chinese: 炸彈像雨點一般落在手無寸鐵的老百姓身上。

sentences.english: The soldiers were billeted on the villagers.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們被分派住宿於該村老百姓家中。

sentences.english: The Chinese citizen felt strongly against the ineptness of the government.
sentences.chinese: 中國老百姓強烈地痛恨政府的無能。

sentences.english: Energy-saving cars are popular with common people.
sentences.chinese: 節能成很受老百姓歡迎。

definition: proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
villager/(Tw) (Internet slang) person who likes to follow online discussions and add their opinions
to live in peace and work happily (idiom)
